channel.title: Ruby?
channel.description:
I've been around learning Ruby for a while and I started to wonder: would ruby be viable for coding rsc server from scratch? And pros and cons?
Let me know.

item.description:

class RscServer; not defined?(:impossible).nil?; end

item.title: Ruby?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Is it possible? Yes. Ruby is more or less a scripting language, so as long as it provides networking capabilities (which Ruby does) you can create any type of network application you want.

Now for the real question. Is it viable? The answer is (in my opinion) probably not. There are other languages, that provide much better networking control than ruby. You can however use ruby to script certain networking events, in just about any language.

Read full topic

I’m not sure if anybody around these forums has any decent experience in coding with ruby, probably would be a dead-end unless you actually have the time and energy to spend.

I call upon Sinisoul.
[/quote]
Sinisoul != RSC[/quote]
Sinisoul = Ruby.
Situation calls for Ruby, doesn’t have to be directly correlating to RSC.

EDIT: Really messed up that quote lol.
